channel.title: World News Headlines, Latest International News, World Breaking News - Times of India
channel.description: World News: TOI brings the latest world news headlines, Current International breaking news world wide. In depth analysis and top news headlines world wide.
channel.copyright: Copyright:(C) Sun, 27 Oct 2024 13:46:09 IST Bennett Coleman & Co. Ltd, http://in.indiatimes.com/policyterms/1554651.cms

image.title: World News Headlines, Latest International News, World Breaking News - Times of India

item.title: ​Biden calls Trump a 'loser,' accuses him of ignoring union workers
item.description: President Biden, speaking in Pennsylvania, labeled former President Trump as a 'loser' and accused him of being anti-labor, warning that his re-election would jeopardize union benefits. Biden emphasized the election as a contrast between decency and lack of decency, urging support for Vice President Harris. The Trump campaign dismissed Biden’s remarks, asserting Trump's representation of decency.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: US approves $2 billion arms deal with Taiwan, sparks fury in China
item.description: The US approves a $2 billion arms deal for Taiwan, including advanced air defense systems, sparking protests from Beijing. Taiwan's new president, Lai Ching-te, emphasizes the package's importance for regional stability amidst increased Chinese military activity around the island, involving record numbers of aircraft and naval vessels.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Storm Trami lands in central Vietnam posing flood risks
item.description: Storm Trami has hit central Vietnam, bringing heavy rains and winds up to 88 kph. Authorities warn of potential floods in urban areas from Ha Tinh to Binh Dinh provinces. Four airports, including Danang's international airport, are temporarily closed. The storm follows last month's deadly typhoon Yagi in northern Vietnam.

item.title: Kamala Harris would get us into World War III: Donald Trump
item.description: As the US presidential elections near, Donald Trump accuses Kamala Harris of being incapable of leadership and argues she would lead the US into World War III. Meanwhile, Michelle Obama defends Harris, criticizing a double standard in scrutiny and highlighting Trump's past behavior and legal issues.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Oil prices likely to fall after Israel shows restraint in strikes on Iran
item.description: Oil prices are predicted to fall as Israel's strike on Iran over the weekend avoided key oil and nuclear sites, ensuring no disruption to energy supplies. Israeli jets targeted missile factories, easing market concerns. Analysts expect a temporary dip in prices, with Brent crude potentially dropping to $74-$75 a barrel.

item.title: Trump or Harris: Who is Israel PM Benjamin Netanyahu likely to support?
item.description: Israeli Prime Minister Netanyahu is hopeful for Trump’s return to the presidency, expecting beneficial policies for Israel despite Trump's mixed messages. Analysts suggest a Trump victory would provide Netanyahu greater freedom, contrasting Biden's more critical stance. Meanwhile, Palestinians remain skeptical of both candidates.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Uzbekistan set to elect parliament loyal to president
item.description: Uzbekistan holds a parliamentary election with all participating parties supporting President Shavkat Mirziyoyev. Due to the lack of opposition, the new parliament will likely remain loyal to Mirziyoyev. Significant changes include a mixed election system and heightened legislative activity concerning foreign relations, particularly with Russia.

item.title: Trump bowls a Google-y, says Pichai called to compliment his McD sortie
item.description: Donald Trump claims that Google CEO Sundar Pichai called him to praise his visit to McDonald's, labeling it a significant event. Trump has made similar claims about calls from Apple’s Tim Cook and META’s Mark Zuckerberg, though these figures haven't confirmed such interactions. Trump's supporters believe these claims indicate his potential election success.
item.dc:creator: Chidanand Rajghatta

item.title: China vows 'countermeasures' over $2 billion US arms deal with Taiwan
item.description: China has strongly condemned the US's approval of a $2 billion arms sale to Taiwan, promising countermeasures to defend its sovereignty. The Pentagon's package includes an advanced missile system used in Ukraine. China urges the US to halt such actions to maintain peace, while Taiwan asserts its right to defend itself.

item.title: Tropical storm Trami leaves 126 dead or missing amid massive flooding and landslides in Philippines
item.description: Tropical Storm Trami has wreaked havoc in the Philippines, leaving at least 85 dead and 41 missing. President Ferdinand Marcos acknowledged ongoing rescue efforts, especially in flooded and isolated areas. With over 5 million people affected, the government plans a major flood control project to combat the unprecedented climate threats.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Photo of Kamala Harris in McDonald's dress going viral. Is it real?
item.description: ​McDonald's said it is true that no records of Harris' employment exist but this is not an aberration and not a reason to think that she didn't work at a McDonald's. "Though we are not a political brand, we’ve been proud to hear former President Trump’s love for McDonald’s and Vice President Harris’s fond memories working under the Arches. While we and our franchisees don’t have records for all positions dating back to the early ’80s, what makes ‘1 in 8’ so powerful is the shared experience so many Americans have had."
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Amber Rose says Beyonce's Kamala Harris speech is copied. Social media users ask 'Who are you?'
item.description: ​Amber Rose stirred a social media frenzy after she claimed the Beyonce's speech for Kamala Harris on Friday was copied from the speech that Amber Rose gave for Donald Trump at the Republican National Convention. "She wanna be me so bad. Literally took my whole speech," Amber Rose's comment went viral with people questioning why Beyonce would even try to copy Amber Rose. Social media users also questioned who Amber Rose is and who on earth wants to be Amber Rose.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: World leaders call for de-escalation
item.description: The US, Britain, and the EU call for de-escalation as Israel hits military targets across Iran in retaliatory strikes. UN chief Antonio Guterres urges an end to the conflict. Israel's actions were described as self-defense, while Russia and various Muslim countries condemned the strikes and warned of further escalation in the Middle East.

item.title: Jamaat backs calls for Bangladesh president's resignation
item.description: Demands for the Bangladesh president's resignation are growing, as key organizations like the Anti-Discrimination Student Movement and Jatiya Nagorik Committee met with senior BNP leaders. They also discussed the idea of a 'second republic,' proposed by Jamaat, aiming to build political consensus on these issues. BNP will evaluate the demands within their party forum.

item.title: US approves $2 billion in arms sales to Taiwan
item.description: The US approved a $2 billion arms sale to Taiwan, including advanced surface-to-air missile systems, amid rising tensions with China. Taiwan's president thanked the US, citing the need for stronger self-defense capabilities. The sales include NASAMS and radar systems to bolster Taiwan's military.

item.title: Ukraine invasion biggest threat to world peace: Olaf Scholz
item.description: German Chancellor Olaf Scholz emphasized the importance of maintaining existing borders and condemned aggression, referring to the Russia-Ukraine conflict as the greatest current threat to international peace. During his three-day visit to India, Scholz engaged with students at BITS Pilani in Goa and highlighted the significance of safe seas and freedom of navigation.

item.title: End of road for Chinese investors in Bordeaux wine
item.description: Many Chinese investors are selling their Bordeaux wine estates due to capital controls in China, declining Asian demand, and underestimated operating costs. Iconic properties, including Chateau Latour Laguens, are hitting the auction block at low prices. Chinese investment in Bordeaux once fueled by dreams of luxury living and high returns, now faces major setbacks.

item.title: Are Musk & Russian President Putin talking?
item.description: Elon Musk has been in regular contact with Russian President Vladimir Putin for the last two years, raising national security concerns due to Musk's government contracts. SpaceX's owner, also a significant supporter of Donald Trump, reportedly discussed various topics, including business and geopolitics, with Putin.

item.title: Tel Aviv's limited attack on Tehran may help foster deal
item.description: Israel's Saturday assault on Iran, in coordination with Washington, targeted missile and air defense sites, aiming to de-escalate tensions in Lebanon and Gaza. The restrained strike followed consultations involving US Secretary of State Antony Blinken. Iran reported four military deaths, while US President Joe Biden noted the precision targeting of military installations.

item.title: Watch: JD Vance said he won't be shocked if Biden votes for Donald Trump
item.description: "He wears Trump hat at the firefighter event. A couple of weeks ago, she (Kamala Harris) was starting one of her big rallies and he (Biden) decides to have a press conference 30 seconds into it. So they're all watching Joe Biden and not Kamala Harris. Or, he'll say something nice here and there about Donald Trump," JD said.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk
